lines.text: Now remember, all you have to do is speak your lines clearly, try not to trip over the furniture, and we'll run longer than "The Mousetrap"
[a play by Agatha Christie that has run continuously since 1952]
Madam, either you will need to cease knitting or I shall need to cease judging.
[the judge has just declared a retrial because the jury cannot agree on a unanimous verdict - it is Miss Marple whose verdict differs from all the other jurors]

[sighing]
If ever there was an open-and-shut case, this was it. One member of that jury was being deliberately perverse.
Many more than one, Inspector, I assure you. Eleven, to be precise.
That woman has made a mockery of my one and only murder.

[to Miss Marple]
I'll fetch the scripts right away.
Ralph, call the theater. Tell them we're rehearsing on stage for a week...
Mr. Cosgood, I wouldn't think I was anyone's idea of a detective.
Not anyone's, dear Miss Marple, but you're mine. You're certainly mine.

[to Craddock]
It may irritate you, Inspector, but sometimes women have superior minds. You'll simply have to accept it.
Mr. Cosgood, whatever I may or may not be, I am definitely no angel... Good-bye! Good luck!
